synopsis: Violinist Caroline Waverly (Gabrielle Anwar) returns to her hometown to retreat from the world, and has no idea she is a prime target for a serial killer stalking the streets.

title: Nora Roberts' High Noon
synopsis: A psychopathic killer (Ivan Sergei) targets a hostage negotiator (Emilie de Ravin) who takes care of her daughter and mother (Cybill Shepherd).
Producer: Tom Cox, Salli Newman, Murray Ord, Jordy Randall

title: The Tenth Circle
synopsis: A family (Kelly Preston, Ron Eldard, Britt Robertson) becomes the focus of a murder investigation when the daughter's accused rapist dies suspiciously.
Production Co: Curmudgeon, Sony Pictures Television, Jaffe/Braunstein Films

title: Flight 93
synopsis: In this dramatization, unsuspecting passengers of United Airlines Flight 93 board the aircraft on the fateful morning of Sept. 11, 2001. After three other planes strike their intended targets, al-Qaida terrorists on Flight 93 make their move, threatening the passengers into submission by claiming to have an explosive onboard. But calls to loved ones reveal the truth, and the passengers -- including Todd Beamer (Brennan Elliott) and Tom Burnett (Jeffrey Nordling) -- plan to take back the flight.

title: Faith of My Fathers
synopsis: Shot down over Vietnam, young John McCain (Shawn Hatosy) endures more than five years of torture and hardship in a POW camp.
Production Co: A+E Networks, L.I.F.T. Production, Alan Barnette Productions

title: Virginia's Run
synopsis: When fisherman Ford Lofton's (Gabriel Byrne) wife dies in a horseback riding accident, the devastated widower tells his daughters they can no longer ride. The younger of the two, Virginia (Lindze Letherman), can't shake her passion for horses, and cares for a young foal named Stormy behind her father's back. When Ford moves to sell Stormy, the girl enlists a friendly horse trainer named Jessie Eastwood (Joanne Whalley) to try to change Ford's mind and let Virginia keep Stormy for her own.
Production Co: Holedigger Films Inc., Blueline Productions, Knightscove Entertainment, Wardenclyffe Entertainment, Virginia's Run Productions Inc., Alliance Atlantis Communications

title: Saving Jessica Lynch
synopsis: During Operation Iraqi Freedom, an Iraqi citizen (Nicholas Guilak) risks his life to help U.S. forces rescue a captive American soldier (Laura Regan).

title: Target Earth
synopsis: A small-town policeman (Christopher Meloni) protects a woman (Marcia Cross) and her child (Courtney Allen Crumpler), who holds the key to defeating an alien invasion.

title: The Last Days of Frankie the Fly
synopsis: Mob enforcer Frankie (Dennis Hopper) is constantly humiliated by his sadistic boss, Sal (Michael Madsen). After Frankie falls for Margaret (Daryl Hannah), a porn star, he agrees to place a bet for her gambling-addicted director, Joey (Kiefer Sutherland), who is already heavily in debt to Sal. When the gangster finds out, he is furious and decides to torture both Joey and Margaret. Unable to take it anymore, Frankie decides to stand up against Sal and extract his revenge.

title: Jake Lassiter: Justice on the Bayou
synopsis: An ex-football-player lawyer (Gerald McRaney) defends a surgeon (James B. Sikking) for malpractice and finds a case of murder.
Producer: Albert J. Salzer, Wayne S. Williams
Production Co: Big Productions, Stephen J. Cannell Productions

title: White Dwarf
synopsis: An arrogant intern (Neal McDonough) from Earth studies under a healer (Paul Winfield) on a 31st-century planet beset by civil war.
Production Co: American Zoetrope, RHI Entertainment, Elemental Films

title: Wagons East!
synopsis: When a group of dissatisfied settlers decides they've had enough of the Wild West, they hire James Harlow, an alcoholic wagon master, to take them back East. The eclectic but happy bunch includes Dr. Phil, prostitute Belle and openly gay man Julian. But the railroad investors don't want it getting out that the West isn't a nice place, so they do everything they can to make sure the group never makes it to their destination.
Producer: Gary Goodman, Bobby Newmyer, Barry Rosen, Jeffrey Silver
Production Co: Carolco Pictures Inc., TriStar Pictures, Outlaw Productions

title: Through the Eyes of a Killer
synopsis: Romance turns to terror for an industrial designer (Marg Helgenberger) who has hired a contractor (Richard Dean Anderson) to work on her apartment.

title: Dead and Alive
synopsis: Both sides of the law hunt Costabile "Gus" Farace (Tony Danza) for slaying a federal drug agent in 1989 New York.

title: El Diablo
synopsis: An Eastern-tenderfoot Texas teacher (Anthony Edwards) teams up with a gunfighter (Louis Gossett Jr.) to save a girl from an outlaw.
Producer: Cynthia Fitzpatrick, Rick Nathanson, Joe Wizan

title: Breaking Point
synopsis: U.S. Intelligence Officer Pike (Corbin Bernsen) is captured by the Germans, who want information about the Allies' secret D-Day invasion. They try torturing him, but when he reveals nothing, they take a new approach. He awakes seven years later and is told he has been in a coma, as a mysterious nurse (Joanna Pacula) tends to him. Pike, however, doubts the reality of his surroundings and is still reluctant to share his information, which his captors insist is now outdated.

title: Nightbreaker
synopsis: This made-for-TV movie chronicles the plight of U.S. soldiers who were victims of secret radiation testing by the government during the Cold War. In the 1950s, Dr. Alexander Brown (Emilio Estevez) helped implement a program that dosed unwitting servicemen with poisonous levels of radiation. In the 1980s, Brown (Martin Sheen) is confronted by a cancer-stricken man who was one of the experiment's subjects. Now the doctor must decide whether he will speak out and blow the lid off the scandal.

title: Bat 21
synopsis: Lt. Col. Iceal Hambleton (Gene Hackman) is shot down behind enemy lines during the waning days of the Vietnam War. His only connection to the outside world is through radio transmission with Capt. Bartholomew "Bird-Dog" Clark (Danny Glover), a pilot who helps him craft an escape plan and maintain his sanity. Lacking survival skills and unfamiliar with the harsh terrain in Vietnam, Hambleton is forced to fight for his life as he witnesses the shocking horrors of war.
Producer: Gary A. Neill, David Fisher, Michael Balson
Distributor: TriStar Pictures, MGM/UA Home Entertainment Inc.
Production Co: Vision PDG, TriStar Pictures, Eagle Films

title: Desperate
synopsis: A boat captain sees a chance for self-redemption in a plot that reunites him with an ex-girlfriend.

title: Youngblood
synopsis: Dean Youngblood (Rob Lowe) is an exceptionally skilled young ice hockey player trying to make a name in the Canadian Junior Hockey circuit and impress scouts from the National Hockey League. However, he becomes bullied by goon Carl Racki (George Finn), a dirty player who has injured Dean's teammate and friend, Derek (Patrick Swayze). After Dean returns to his childhood home deflated, his father (Eric Nesterenko) tries to toughen up the hockey prodigy for a rematch with Racki.
Producer: Peter Bart, Peter Markle, Patrick Wells

title: Hot Dog ... The Movie
synopsis: Hoping to prove his skill at freestyle skiing, Idaho farm boy Harkin (Patrick Houser) heads to a competition at California's Squaw Valley ski resort, offering a ride to hitchhiking musician Sunny (Tracy N. Smith) on the way. Harkin's main rival in the contest is Rudi (John Patrick Reger), an arrogant Austrian. With guidance from former professional skier Dan (David Naughton), Harkin sets out to win the prize while being pursued by the gorgeous Sylvia (Shannon Tweed), making Sunny jealous.
Production Co: Edward S. Feldman Productions, Hot Dog, Hot Dog Partnership

title: The Personals
synopsis: A recently divorced Minneapolis man (Bill Schoppert) advertises for dates and meets a married psychiatrist (Karen Landry).

title: Echelon Conspiracy
synopsis: Mysterious phone messages prompt the deadly targeting of a young American engineer.
Rating: PG-13 (Sequences of Intense Action|Brief Language|Sequences of Intense Violence|Some Sexuality)

title: Jane Doe
synopsis: A woman (Teri Hatcher) seeks help from her ex-husband (Rob Lowe) after an official from a weapons corporation frames her for murder.
Production Co: Zinc Entertainment Inc., USA Films, Winchester Entertainment PLC, USA Network

title: Simon Sez
synopsis: Interpol agent Simon (Dennis Rodman) is gathering information about the weapons trade on the French Riviera and trying to pinpoint the man at its center. Meanwhile, Nick (Dane Cook) -- an old classmate of Simon's -- asks him for help. Nick needs to rescue his employer's daughter, who appears to have been kidnapped by the same people Simon is tracking down. The pair must get to the bottom of the increasingly dangerous situation with the help of two monks and a feisty woman.
Screenwriter: Moshe Diamant, Rudy Cohen, Andrew Miller, Andrew Lowery

title: Aces: Iron Eagle III
synopsis: Veteran Air Force pilot Charles "Chappy" Sinclair (Louis Gossett Jr.) is drawn into international intrigue when Anna Morales (Rachel McLish), the sister of a recently deceased friend, asks for his help. Anna reveals that her brother died at the hands of Gustav Kleiss (Paul Freeman), an ex-Nazi who runs a drug ring in Peru and is holding her father hostage. Sinclair enlists a number of his air-show buddies to join the mission, and they depart for Peru to take on the ruthless criminal.
Production Co: Carolco Pictures Inc., Seven Arts Productions

title: Grow House
synopsis: Two stoners who are overwhelmed with debt decide to break into the medical marijuana business. However, they need to learn how to grow it since they're already experts at smoking it.
Rating: R (Drug Use Throughout|Language Throughout|Language Including Sexual Refe)

title: Friday After Next
synopsis: Finds Craig (Ice Cube) and Day-Day (Mike Epps) back in the old neighborhood where it all began. It's Christmas time and a ghetto Santa Claus breaks into their run-down apartment, stealing all their presents, along with anything else he can stuff into his sack, including the rent money hidden in their stereo speakers. Their only hope to not get evicted before Christmas is to take jobs as security guards at a local mall, where they learn some comic lessons about the true meaning of the holidays.
Screenwriter: Ice Cube, DJ Pooh, Ice Cube
Production Co: New Line Cinema, Avery Pix, Cubevision
Sound Mix: Dolby Stereo, Dolby Digital, Dolby A, Surround, Dolby SR

title: The Wash
synopsis: "The Wash" is an action-comedy starring Snoop Dogg and Dr. Dre. As mismatched roommates working at a car wash, they come together to rescue their boss (George Wallace) from a couple of first-time kidnappers. If they don't settle their differences and get Mr. Washington back, the good times at "The Wash" will soon come to an end.
Producer: DJ Pooh, Philip G. Atwell, Kip Konwiser
Sound Mix: SDDS, Dolby SR, Dolby Digital, Surround, Dolby A, Dolby Stereo

title: 3 Strikes
synopsis: Rob Douglas (Brian Hooks) is just released from jail. The state adopts a "3 strikes" rule for felons that involves serious penalties. Hooks has 2 strikes, and wants to change his life for the better. When a friend picks him up, they are pulled over, and his friend shoots at police officers, and Hooks escapes. Now Hooks, a wanted man, must clear his name of having nothing to do with the shooting.

title: Next Friday
synopsis: Craig (Ice Cube) bails his friend out of trouble, survives a climatic confrontation with Debo, the neighborhood bully, and ends up with the girl. In "Next Friday" the bully is back as Debo, who spent two years behind bars, is released from prison. Fearing for his sons safety, Craig's father (John Witherspoon) sends his son to live with Uncle Elroy (Don "D.C." Curry). However, Craig soon learns that trouble can find you no matter where you live.
Screenwriter: Ice Cube, Ice Cube, DJ Pooh

title: Friday
synopsis: It's Friday and Craig Jones (Ice Cube) has just gotten fired for stealing cardboard boxes. To make matters worse, rent is due, he hates his overbearing girlfriend, Joi (Paula Jai Parker), and his best friend, Smokey (Chris Tucker), owes the local drug dealer money -- and that's all before lunch. As the hours drag on, Jones and Smokey experience the gamut of urban life, complete with crackheads, shoot-outs and overly sexual pastors, concentrated into one single, unbelievable Friday.
Distributor: New Line Home Video [us], New Line Cinema
Rating: R (Drug Use|A Brutal Fight|Pervasive Strong Language)

title: Depravity
synopsis: When three residents suspect their reclusive neighbor is a serial killer, they break into his apartment only to uncover a hidden fortune in stolen art. But their discovery turns into a nightmare as they're ensnared in a sadistic game of survival, where every corner hides a new horror. Outsmart the killer or become his next victim.
Producer: Dorothy Aufiero, Paul Tamasy, Jordan Gertner, Scott Clayton, Wych Kaosayananda, Gary A. Hirsch
Production Co: Red Hawk Entertainment, Fourth Wall Entertainment, Kaos Entertainment
Rating: R (Some Sexual Content|Bloody Violence|Language|Brief Full Nudity)

title: Latency
synopsis: When Hana (Sasha Luss), a professional gamer who suffers from acute agoraphobia, is asked to trial sophisticated new gaming equipment which uses AI to interpret the electrical activity of her brain, she sees an opportunity to enhance her game. As Hana and her best friend Jen (Alexis Ren) experiment with this new technology, the line between reality and Hana's subconscious quickly begins to blur and she starts to wonder if the device is helping her or serving a more sinister force.
Producer: Jordan Gertner, Scott Clayton, Wych Kaosayananda, Gary A. Hirsch, Barry Brooker

title: Sheroes
synopsis: Isabelle Fuhrman (Orphan: First Kill), Sasha Luss (Anna), Wallis Day (Batwoman), and Skai Jackson (Bunk'd) star in the ultimate adrenaline-fueled thrill ride from a producer of Spring Breakers. When four thick-as-thieves friends arrive in Thailand for a hedonistic adventure, they quickly find themselves in over their heads when one of them is kidnapped by a notorious drug lord. As they fight to stay alive and protect each other, they'll employ their unique set of skills and unleash their fierce loyalty in a heart-pumping battle for survival.
Producer: Jordan Gertner, Scott Clayton, Tara L. Craig, Wych Kaosayananda, Gary A. Hirsch, Chris Pak, Chan Chun Pang
Production Co: BondIt Media Capital, The Squid Farm, Buffalo 8 Productions

title: One Night in Bangkok
synopsis: A hit man pays an unwitting female cabbie to drive him around Bangkok to kill his targets.
Producer: Wych Kaosayananda, Mark Dacascos, Scott Clayton, Adam Zachary Smith

title: Paradise Z
synopsis: Two young women's plans to live a normal life in isolation after a world-ending apocalypse go awry when they are discovered.

title: Invincible
synopsis: Col. John Taylor enlists billionaire inventor Leor Teska to fund a secret site to test Teska's new nano technology for military applications. When one of the test subjects, Brock Cortez, escapes, Teska's head of security, Cam Devore, must track him down.
Screenwriter: Daniel Zirilli, Johnny Strong, Robert De Lay
Production Co: Pop Art Film Factory, Kaos Entertainment

title: The Driver
synopsis: A father fights to rescue his family from the undead when an attack destroys their survival compound.
Production Co: Ingenious Media, Kaos Entertainment, Head Gear Films, Solution Entertainment Group

title: Encounter in the Third Dimension
synopsis: This mix of fact-based documentary and camp comedy focuses on a professor (Stuart Pankin) as he explains the history and technology of 3-D film-making, with the help of his flying robot assistant, M.A.X. Enlisting late-night television temptress Elvira (Cassandra Peterson) to illustrate his new invention, Real-O-Vision, the professor loses control and all goes haywire. In the end, Elvira turns the professor into cardboard and traps M.A.X. inside a TV, debating whether or not to release him.

title: Thrill Ride: The Science of Fun
synopsis: Filmmaker Ben Stassen presents the history of roller coasters, motion simulators, motion pictures and computer animation.

title: Taken 3
synopsis: Ex-covert operative Bryan Mills (Liam Neeson) and his ex-wife, Lenore (Famke Janssen), are enjoying a reconciliation when Lenore is brutally murdered. Bryan is framed for the crime and flees, with the CIA, FBI and police all in hot pursuit. For the last time, he channels his rage and particular set of skills into hunting down Lenore's real killers, taking his revenge and protecting the one important thing left in his life: his daughter, Kim (Maggie Grace).
Production Co: EuropaCorp, M6 Films Production, Canal Plus
Rating: PG-13 (Intense Seq of Violence/Action|Brief Strong Language)

title: Taken 2
synopsis: Two years ago, retired CIA agent Bryan Mills (Liam Neeson) used his "particular set of skills" to rescue his daughter, Kim (Maggie Grace), from kidnappers. Since then, Kim has been learning self-defense from her father, and Bryan has been on a personal mission to reunite with his ex-wife (Famke Janssen). In Istanbul, Bryan and his family cross paths with Murad (Rade Serbedzija), whose son died at Bryan's hand during Kim's rescue. Murad wants revenge, and he'll stop at nothing to get it.
Production Co: EuropaCorp, Grive Productions, M6 Films Production
Rating: PG-13 (Intense Sequences of Violence|Intense Sequences of Action|Some Sensuality)

title: Colombiana
synopsis: In 1992 Bogota, a little girl (Amandla Stenberg) watches crime lord Don Luis (Beto Benites) and his henchman Marco (Jordi Mollà) murder her parents. Fifteen years later, the now-grown Cataleya (Zoe Saldana), who is named for a Colombian orchid, works as a contract killer for her Chicago-based uncle (Cliff Curtis). Leaving a lipstick drawing of her namesake on every victim, Cataleya carries out her assignments with cold, frightening efficiency and dreams of avenging her family.
Production Co: Canal+, EuropaCorp, Grive Productions, TF1 Films Productions
Rating: PG-13 (Disturbing Images|Brief Strong Language|Intense Sequences of Action|Sexuality|Violence)

title: Transporter 3
synopsis: Mob courier Frank Martin's (Jason Statham) latest assignment pairs him with Valentina (Natalya Rudakova), the cynical daughter of a Ukrainian official. While her father ponders what to do with three boatloads of toxic waste, Frank must guard the problematic woman and prevent her from wandering too far from his vehicle, or risk triggering the explosive shackles they both wear.
Rating: PG-13 (Sequences of Intense Action|Drug Material|Sequences of Intense Violence|Sexual Content)

title: Wire Room
synopsis: Action legend Bruce Willis comes out with guns blazing as Shane Mueller, a Homeland Security agent who runs the Wire Room, a high-tech command center surveilling the most dangerous criminals. New recruit Justin Rosa (Kevin Dillon, "Entourage") must monitor arms-smuggling cartel member Eddie Flynn -- and keep him alive at all costs. When a SWAT team descends on Flynn's home, Rosa breaks protocol and contacts the gangster directly to save his life. As gunmen break into the Wire Room and chaos erupts, Mueller and Rosa make a final, desperate stand against the corrupt agents and officials who seek to destroy evidence and kill them both.

The innocent girl transforms herself into a kick-ass female fighting force who sets out to liberate the country from the insane cheese fascists.

title: Jeepers Creepers: Reborn

As the festival gets underway and the blood-soaked entertainment builds to a frenzy, Laine believes that something unearthly has been summoned and that for the first time in 23 years...The Creeper is back.

title: Iron Sky: The Coming Race
synopsis: Following the devastating aftermath of nuclear war on Earth, a former Nazi moon base has become the last refuge for mankind. Limited supplies and overpopulation threaten the survivors until Obi, the leader's daughter, finds a map pointing to a power buried deep under Earth's wasted surface that could save mankind or destroy it once and for all. When an old enemy leads the heroes on an adventure into the Hollow Earth, they must fight an ancient shape-shifting reptilian race to save humanity.
